result.execSummary:
The defendant Raymond S Neeser was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to prison sentence currently serving.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall not possess any illegal substances or drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.
Defendant shall have no contact directly or indirectly with William and Bonnie Savka, or go upon their premises.

Provide biological specimen to State Crime Lab for DNA analysis.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall possess prescriptions only with a valid prescription.
Defendant shall obtain prescriptions from one (1) pharmacy and report any changes or medications to his Agent within 72 hours.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

records.addlTxt:
DA Snider present.
Def. present - in custody.
Atty. Tom Johnson present.
Ct. #1 - NC plea
Plea questionnaire filed with the Court.
Court questions def.
Court finds def. waives his rights, finds a factual basis exists and finds def. guilty of Ct. #1.
Ct. #2, Ct. #3, and Ct. #4 D&RI.
No PSI is requested - Court reviews previous PSIs from 14 CF 198 and 14 CF 244.
Back on the record at 2:40 pm.
State has complied w/victim notifications.
Victim impact statement filed with the Court.
Restitution summary filed with the Court.
Recommendations by counsel.
Statements by def.
Probation - SW - 1 year - consecutive to prison sentence currently serving.
Conditions:
1.  pay costs of the action + RHT surcharge of $28.33 + DRGOD of $10.00.
2.  pay restitution of $283.25.
3.  def. to participate in any assessments deemed appropriate and follow treatment recommendations arising therefrom.
4.  def. to provide DNA sample.
5.  def. to not possess any illegal substances or drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.
6.  def. to possess prescriptions only with a valid prescription - obtain prescriptions from one (1) pharmacy - report any changes of medications to his Agent w/in 72 hours.
7.  def. to maintain absolute sobriety.
8.  def. to have no contact (directly or indirectly) with William & Bonnie Savka or go upon their premises.
Appeal rights explained to def.
Voter ineligibility restrictions explained to def.
Firearm restrictions explained to def.
